intro: Marlierea obversa, commonly known as the silverleaf marlierea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Marlierea obversa is valued in horticulture for its ornamental qualities and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
